page.title: 04WOODLAND - BROCKWORTH AREA
page.content: Brockworth Wood is at the top of Coopers Hill.It is a small {wood} but has a rich variety of {animals} and {birds} - "{Squirrels} roam the trees but I've never seen a woodpecker" said a local. Most of the trees are {beech} but a wide variety of {shrub and {brush} provides suitable food and cover. With the felling of trees it becomes easier to spot {badgers,foxes and rabbits.}An old quarry has been revealed too. The floor of the wood is soft and mossy giving off the smell of rotting wood. There are lots of {flowers} at the moment with a sea of bluebells,as well as primrose,violet and the cuckoo pint. Cowslips are to be seen just before entering the wood above Brockworth. Sighted that day-25 {rabbits},6 {hares},10 {shrews},20 {fieldmice} and 10 {adders}.
